job_title: Therapeutic Behavioral Specialist in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Family like team culture, supportive and validating coworkers and supervisors, amazing training and growth opportunities, sense of pride for directly changing families lives
cons: Pay isn't the best because mental health is underfunded

review_title: Good Company Mission; Poor Upper Management
job_title: Assistant Supervisor in Camarillo, CA
pros: The company itself means well with its mission and help with the community. The pay is decent for a non profit.
cons: Understaffed because the job is incredibly physically and mentally draining (fast turnover rate). The information interview does well in preparing the difficulties of the job, but needs to be more realistic to employees on the number of hours you can potentially work. I was working 18+ hours no bathroom or food break due to the intensity of situations regarding the youth.

job_title: Clinical Psychologist in Camarillo, CA
pros: Full experience supporting kids in need
cons: Management structure dismissive towards trainees, does not prioritize staff concerns, limited room for internal growth

job_title: Therapeutic Behavioral Specialist in Santa Barbara, CA
pros:
Friendly co-workers and supervisors.
Supervision in both an individual and group setting.
Opportunity to develop effective mental health practitioner introductory and higher level (assessment, crisis planning, data analyses).
cons:
Long working hours.
Significant underpayment.

job_title: School Counselor in Santa Maria, CA
pros:
Flexible hours 
Enjoyed working with the kiddos
cons:
Low pay 
Stressful at times

job_title: Care Coordinator in Camarillo, CA
pros: Experience will take you far
cons: Low staffing, high work load

job_title: Manager in Camarillo, CA
pros: Flexible family friendly. Great mission
cons: Cannot work remote, must be present

job_title: Production Doormat in Little Rock, AR
pros: snacks, snacks, snacks, snacks, snacks.
cons: work, work, work, work, work.

job_title: Pre-doctoral Intern in Camarillo, CA
pros: Amazing training experience in trauma psychology
cons: very long hours and high expectations

review_title: Good job starting out in this field
job_title: Therapeutic Behavioral Specialist in Santa Barbara, CA
pros:
- Flexible schedule
- Great management
- Every other Friday off
cons:
- Long days
- Long commutes to clients

job_title: YDS in Camarillo, CA
pros: Upper management is supportive. Very organized. Wants to help the kids.
cons: Low pay for part time due to not getting benefits

job_title: Crisis Intervention Specialist in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I was able to leave
cons: Unprofessional management, disorder and harassment.

review_title: Love working with kids, but this non-profit does not look after its employees
job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Camarillo, CA
pros: Working with children and seeing all the programs available to families/children in crisis is wonderful. It is definitely a rewarding job in that the time and energy you devote to these kids is genuinely needed and appreciated. It is also really fun working with the kids, a lot of the job is play and going on off campus "outings" with the kids. So work some days consist of an afternoon at the beach and then ice cream before heading back to campus.
cons: Lunch breaks are taken on the job so there's no time to really relax or unwind and enjoy a meal in peace. You must stay on campus for your lunch and are occasionally given one 10 minute break during a shift. This becomes stressful when shifts can last anywhere between 8-10hrs.

review_title: Fantastic place to make info a career
job_title: Therapeutic Behavioral Specialist in Camarillo, CA
pros:
-Rewarding experience and a chance to change lives.
-Lackluster pay is made up for by great benefits!
-Supervisors and management team are on your side. They will go up to bat for you if you are honest, and are understanding about mistakes or shortcomings.
-Plenty of people in every department have been with Casa Pacifica for a long time. These people all started in direct care, and if they're willing to stay for 10+ years, you know that management is doing something right.
cons: It's the mental health field, so don't expect to get rich by working here. Staff turn-over is higher on campus as opposed to community services as well, so keep that in mind.

review_title: A tough job, any way you look at it.
job_title: in Camarillo, CA
pros: Working with troubled children can be very rewarding when interventions are effective.  The employees have a good sense of humor.  The work is never boring.  The activities staff are required to participate in with the children are diverse, fun, and interesting.
cons: The hours are long and overtime follows a nonstandard structure--only work over 40 hours a week is considered overtime, and 12 or 16 hour days are compensated without overtime.  Breaks are rare.  The youth/clients can be aggressive and very disrespectful.  Communication between shifts can be inconsistent.

job_title: DCS in Camarillo, CA
pros: The staff and the youth! What a great experience working with direct care staff who are committed  to building supportive  and caring relationships with the kids.
cons: Upper management and leadership is all about the $ not caring for kids or direct care staff.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Camarillo, CA
pros: As far as agencies go, employees, leadership, etc., some of the best.
cons:
Little compensation, however, hired at will and exempt status, so you might be expected to work 50-80 hours on any given week and it doesn't matter.  
Upper/Senior management will make decisions as they please, with a focus on residential services, turning a blind eye on Community Based Services, staff, etc.

review_title: Youth Development Specialist at Casa Pacifica
job_title: Youth Development Specialist in Camarillo, CA
pros: The people you work with are amazing. You literally change lives every time you come to work. The relationships with the kids will stick with you forever.
cons: No room for moving up the company ladder. Happens few and far between. You may stay at the same position for years before something opens up.

job_title: Para Educator in Camarillo, CA
pros: Flexible schedule, great coworkers, supportive staff, great moral compass
cons: Safety of staff, frustration with the corporateness of the organization. Feeling unsupported by leadership when youth acted out.

job_title: Front Desk and Transportation Coordinator in San Diego, CA
pros: Good hours, very good environment and great team of employees. Also, excellent employers.
cons: No space to grow as an employee.

job_title: in Camarillo, CA
pros: Great company culture, close relationships with management
cons: Lower pay than average & high employee turnover

job_title: Therapeutic Behavioral Specialist in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Support the local community in need.
cons: Pay is what you would expect in a non-profit.
